get.summary:
Find accounts in the CRM system, using the provided CEQL search expression. The search expression in CEQL is the WHERE clause in a typical SQL query, but without the WHERE keyword. For example, to search for all accounts whose name contains the word 'data', the search expression parameter will be where=name like '%data%'. If a search expression is not provided, then the first 200 records will be returned.

If a value of true is specified for the includeDeleted flag, then any soft-deleted records will also be considered in the searched records.

401.description: Unauthorized - An invalid element token, user secret and/or org secret provided

406.description: Not acceptable - The response content type does not match the 'Accept' header value

409.description: Conflict - If a resource being created already exists

415.description: Unsupported media type - The server cannot handle the requested Content-Type

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: The authorization tokens. The format for the header value is 'Element <token>, User <user secret>'

parameters.name: nextPage
parameters.description: The next page cursor, taken from the response header: `elements-next-page-token`

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The page size for pagination, which defaults to 200 if not supplied

parameters.name: where
parameters.description: The CEQL search expression, or the where clause, without the WHERE keyword, in a typical SQL query. For example, to search for accounts last modified on or after 'Jan 15, 2014', the search expression will be where=lastModifiedDate>='2014-01-15T00:00:00.000Z'. When this parameter is omitted, all accounts are returned in a paginated fashion.

get.summary:
Find leads in the CRM system, using the provided CEQL search expression. The search expression in CEQL is the WHERE clause in a typical SQL query, but without the WHERE keyword. For example, to search for all leads whose name contains the word 'data', the search expression parameter will be where=name like '%data%'. If a search expression is not provided, then the first 200 records will be returned.

If a value of true is specified for the includeDeleted flag, then any soft-deleted records will also be considered in the searched records.

parameters.name: where
parameters.description: The CEQL search expression, or the where clause, without the WHERE keyword, in a typical SQL query. For example, to search for leads last modified on or after 'Jan 15, 2014', the search expression will be where=lastModifiedDate>='2014-01-15T00:00:00.000Z'. When this parameter is omitted, all leads are returned in a paginated fashion.

get.summary:
Find opportunities in the CRM system, using the provided CEQL search expression. The search expression in CEQL is the WHERE clause in a typical SQL query, but without the WHERE keyword. For example, to search for all opportunities whose name contains the word 'data', the search expression parameter will be where=name like '%data%'. If a search expression is not provided, then the first 200 records will be returned.

If a value of true is specified for the includeDeleted flag, then any soft-deleted records will also be considered in the searched records.

When this parameter is omitted, all opportunities are returned in a paginated fashion.

accessRole.description: References a value in a user-defined list at Setup > Users/Roles > Manage Roles. This value sets the role assigned to this customer. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation. For more information, see getSelectValue of the Platform Guide.

accountNumber.description: Assigned account number for this customer.

aging.description: The overdue A/R balance is shown here with the balance totals for each aging period.

aging1.description: The overdue A/R balance is shown here.

aging2.description: The overdue A/R balance is shown here.

aging3.description: The overdue A/R balance is shown here.

aging4.description: The overdue A/R balance is shown here.

alcoholRecipientType.description: FedEx requires that all packages containing alcohol are declared with the intended recipient type on the shipping note. This preference sets the default type for this customer.

altEmail.description: Enter an alternative email address for this person.

altName.description: This is the name of this person or company.

altPhone.description: Phone numbers can be entered in the following formats: 99...

balance.description: Customer's current accounts receivable balance. This field is returned in an advanced search only. It is not returned when using the CustomerSearchBasic search object. Note that in your advanced search you must set the BodyFieldsOnly flag to false. This field is a read-only field. NetSuite converts the balance of all transactions in foreign currencies to your preferred currency using the exchange rate for the current date.

billPay.description: When enabled, the companyName, phone, accountNumber field.

buyingReason.description: Choose the prospect or customer's reason for buying from your company. You can create additional options for this field at <_TABNAME=LIST_CRMOTHERLIST_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=LIST_CRMOTHERLIST_> > CRM Lists.
buyingReason.x-displayName: Buying Reason{:The reason a customer is considering a prospective deal}

buyingTimeFrame.description: Select the time frame for the prospect or customer to purchase. You can create additional options for this field at <_TABNAME=LIST_CRMOTHERLIST_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=LIST_CRMOTHERLIST_> > CRM Lists.
buyingTimeFrame.x-displayName: Buying Time Frame{:The time frame for a prospective deal}

campaignCategory.description: References a value in a user defined list at Setup > Marketing > Campaign Categories. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation. For more information, see getSelectValue of the Platform Guide.

category.description: References a value in a user defined list at Setup > Account.

clickStream.description: Read-only field that returns the click stream for this customer on first visit.

comments.description: Enter any other information you wish to track for this customer.

companyName.description: The name of the customer. Required when billPay is enable.

consolAging.description: The overdue consolidated A/R balance is shown here with the balance totals for each aging period. These totals include the balance from all the customers and subcustomers in this hierarchy.

consolAging1.description: The overdue consolidated A/R balance is shown here with the balance totals for each aging period. These totals include the balance from all the customers and subcustomers in this hierarchy.

consolAging2.description: The overdue consolidated A/R balance is shown here with the balance totals for each aging period. These totals include the balance from all the customers and subcustomers in this hierarchy.

consolAging3.description: The overdue consolidated A/R balance is shown here with the balance totals for each aging period. These totals include the balance from all the customers and subcustomers in this hierarchy.

consolAging4.description: The overdue consolidated A/R balance is shown here with the balance totals for each aging period. These totals include the balance from all the customers and subcustomers in this hierarchy.

consolBalance.description: The current accounts receivable balance due for the customer-subcustomer hierarchy this customer is a part of is shown here.

consolDaysOverdue.description: This field shows the number of days overdue the consolidated overdue balance is.

consolDepositBalance.description: This field displays the total amount of unapplied deposits for the customer-subcustomer hierarchy this customer is a member of. Deposits are recorded in the general ledger, as a liability, when the customer makes an advance payment before delivery of goods or services. A deposit balance exists until the goods or services are delivered. Deposits do not affect the customer's accounts receivable balance.

consolOverdueBalance.description: This field shows the consolidated total owed for open transactions for this customer-subcustomer hierarchy that are past their due date based on the invoice terms. Note: For open transactions that do not have a due date, the transaction date is used as the due date to calculate this total.

consolUnbilledOrders.description: This field displays the total amount of orders that have been entered but not yet billed for the customer-subcustomer hierarchy this customer is a part of. If you have enabled the preference Customer Credit Limit Includes Orders, then this total is included in credit limit calculations. Set this preference at <_TABNAME=ADMI_ACCTSETUP_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=ADMI_ACCTSETUP_> > Set Up Accounting > General.

creditHoldOverride.description: This is a read-only field. Possible values include _auto, _on, and _off.

creditLimit.description: A credit limit for this customer. If set, and depending on preferences, a warning is generated when this customer's limit is exceeded during a transaction addition.

currency.description: References a value in a user-defined list at Lists > Account

customForm.description: References an existing custom form for this record type.

dateCreated.description: When adding a record, this field defaults to the current system date and time. This field cannot be overwritten. Note: In search, this field respects search criteria down to the second.

daysOverdue.description: The number of days overdue this balance is overdue is shown here.

defaultAddress.description: Read-only field that returns the default Billing address.

defaultOrderPriority.description: Enter a number to designate the priority for this customer.

depositBalance.description: This field is returned in an advanced search only. It is not returned when using the CustomerSearchBasic search object. Note that in your advanced search you must set the BodyFieldsOnly flag to false. This field is a read-only field

displaySymbol.description: Enter a currency symbol and text to use for this currency. Include spaces if you want to separate the symbol from the currency value. For example, $ USD or $CAD. Use the Symbol Placement field to select where the symbol appears.

drAccount.description: Select the deferred revenue account to use by default to post revenue reclassification amounts generated by revenue reclassification journal entries for this customer. You can override this account on a sales order for this customer.

emailPreference.description: Reference to a value in a system list. Values: _PDF, _HTM.

emailTransactions.description: Set a preferred transaction delivery method for this customer. Choose to send transactions by regular mail, by email, by fax, or by a combination of the three. Then, when you select the customer on a transaction, their preferred delivery method is marked by default. * Email – Check this box to check the To Be Emailed box by default on transactions when this customer is selected. * Print – Check this box to check the To Be Printed box by default on transactions when this customer is selected. * Fax – Check this box to check the To Be Faxed box by default on transactions when this customer is selected. Once you enter these settings on the customer record, these boxes are checked by default for transactions created from the customer record or for transactions that are copied or converted. Note: These settings override any customized settings on transaction forms you use. There are also preferences to set default values for new customer records at Setup > Company > Preferences > Printing, Fax,& Email Preferences. On the Print subtab, Fax subtab, or Email subtab, check Customers Default to [Print/Fax/Email] Transactions. You can also set these fields using the Mass Update function. Go to Lists > Mass Updates > Mass Updates > General and click Customer.

endDate.description: Projected end date for this customer (used in the case of.

entityId.description: The name of the customer record. Required on add and upda.

entityStatus.description: References a value in the status list defined at Setup.

estimatedBudget.description: Enter the estimated budget the prospect or customer has for this opportunity.
estimatedBudget.x-displayName: Estimated Budget{:The estimated budget for a prospective deal}

fax.description: Sets the fax number for the customer.

faxTransactions.description: Set a preferred transaction delivery method for this customer. Choose to send transactions by regular mail, by email, by fax, or by a combination of the three. Then, when you select the customer on a transaction, their preferred delivery method is marked by default. * Email – Check this box to check the To Be Emailed box by default on transactions when this customer is selected. * Print – Check this box to check the To Be Printed box by default on transactions when this customer is selected. * Fax – Check this box to check the To Be Faxed box by default on transactions when this customer is selected. Once you enter these settings on the customer record, these boxes are checked by default for transactions created from the customer record or for transactions that are copied or converted. Note: These settings override any customized settings on transaction forms you use. There are also preferences to set default values for new customer records at Setup > Company > Preferences > Printing, Fax,& Email Preferences. On the Print subtab, Fax subtab, or Email subtab, check Customers Default to [Print/Fax/Email] Transactions. You can also set these fields using the Mass Update function. Go to Lists > Mass Updates > Mass Updates > General and click Customer.

firstName.description: Required when the isPerson field is set as TRUE designation

firstVisit.description: Read-only field that returns the date the customer first.

fxAccount.description: Select the revenue account to use by default to post foreign currency adjustments that result when exchange rates are different for billing and revenue postings for this customer. You must select an income account. You can override this account on a sales order for this customer.

giveAccess.description: Enables access to your NetSuite account for the customer.

globalSubscriptionStatus.description: Email recipients can have one of four subscription statuses: * Confirmed Opt-In - When an email recipient has indicated that they want to receive your campaign and bulk merge email, they are assigned this subscription status. Only a recipient can set his or her subscription status to Confirmed Opt-In. * Soft Opt-In - Recipients with this status can receive opt-in messages that enable them to confirm whether or not they want to receive your email campaigns as well as bulk email. You can set a recipient’s status to Soft Opt-In manually or through a mass update. * Soft Opt-Out - Recipients with this status cannot receive campaign or bulk email messages but can receive opt-in messages. You can change this subscription status to Soft Opt-In manually or through a mass update. * Confirmed Opt-Out - Only the recipient can set their subscription status to Confirmed Opt-Out. Recipients with this status cannot receive email campaigns, bulk email, or opt-in messages. Recipients with this status can only opt in again through the Customer Center or by clicking the link in an email message they have received prior to opting out.

homePhone.description: Only settable when isPerson is set to TRUE defining this.

image.description: References an image file that has already been uploaded.

isBudgetApproved.description: Check this box if the customer's budget has been approved.
isBudgetApproved.x-displayName: Budget Approved{:Whether there is an approved budget for a prospective deal}

isInactive.description: This field is false by default.

isPerson.description: By default, this is set to True which specifies the type ...

keywords.description: This is a read-only field that returns the search engine

language.description: References a value in the Language system list.

lastName.description: Required when the isPerson field is set as TRUE designating this customer as an Individual.

lastPageVisited.description: This field displays the last page this customer viewed on his or her most recent visit to your Web site.

lastVisit.description: Read-only field that returns the date the customer first visited the account website.

leadSource.description: If the Marketing Automation feature is not enabled, references a value in a user-defined list created by going to Setup > Sales > CRM Lists. Sets how this customer was referred to the organization. For details on how to modify this list via Web services, see �LeadSource� in the Records Guide. (Note: If the Marketing Automation feature is enabled, the lead source list originates from your list of campaigns.) In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation. For more information, see getSelectValue of the Platform Guide.

middleName.description: Only settable when isPerson is set to TRUE defining this customer as an individual.

mobilePhone.description: Only settable when isPerson is set to TRUE defining this customer as an individual.

negativeNumberFormat.description: Select the customer’s negative number format preference, if any. The format controls whether the negative number is preceded by the minus sign (-) or is enclosed in parentheses ( ).

numberFormat.description: Select the customer’s positive number format preference, if any. The format controls the thousands separator and decimals display.

openingBalance.description: Enter the opening balance of this customer's account.

openingBalanceAccount.description: Select the account this opening balance is applied to.

openingBalanceDate.description: Enter the date of the balance entered in the Opening Balance field.

overdueBalance.description: This field is returned in an advanced search only. It is not returned when using the CustomerSearchBasic search object. Note that in your advanced search you must set the BodyFieldsOnly flag to false. This field is a read-only field. NetSuite converts the overdue balance of all transactions in foreign currencies to your preferred currency using the exchange rate for the current date.

overrideCurrencyFormat.description: Check this box to customize the currency format.
overrideCurrencyFormat.x-displayName: Override Currency Format{:override default currency format}

parent.description: If this customer is subcustomer of another customer or a smaller entity of another customer, select the larger parent customer here. If you select a parent customer in this field, this record will show indented under the parent customer in the Customers list.

partner.description: References a partner record. This value sets the partner responsible for referring this customer. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation. For more information, see getSelectValue of the Platform Guide.

password.description: Sets the password assigned to allow this customer access to NetSuite. As of Version 2014 Release 1, the password must be at least 6 characters long. See the topic NetSuite Password Requirements in the NetSuite Help Center for more information.

phoneticName.description: Enter the furigana character you want to use to sort this record.

prefCCProcessor.description: References a record at Setup > Company > Credit Card Processors. Sets the credit card processor used to process orders. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation. For more information, see getSelectValue of the Platform Guide.

priceLevel.description: References a value in a user-defined list at Setup > Accounting > Setup Tasks > Accounting Lists > Price Level. This value sets the price level for selling to this customer. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation. For more information, see getSelectValue of the Platform Guide.

printOnCheckAs.description: What you enter here prints on the Pay to the Order of line of a check instead of what you entered in the Customer field.

printTransactions.description: Set a preferred transaction delivery method for this customer. Choose to send transactions by regular mail, by email, by fax, or by a combination of the three. Then, when you select the customer on a transaction, their preferred delivery method is marked by default. * Email – Check this box to check the To Be Emailed box by default on transactions when this customer is selected. * Print – Check this box to check the To Be Printed box by default on transactions when this customer is selected. * Fax – Check this box to check the To Be Faxed box by default on transactions when this customer is selected. Once you enter these settings on the customer record, these boxes are checked by default for transactions created from the customer record or for transactions that are copied or converted. Note: These settings override any customized settings on transaction forms you use. There are also preferences to set default values for new customer records at Setup > Company > Preferences > Printing, Fax,& Email Preferences. On the Print subtab, Fax subtab, or Email subtab, check Customers Default to [Print/Fax/Email] Transactions. You can also set these fields using the Mass Update function. receivablesAccount.description: Choose the A/R account to use by default on receivables transactions for this customer. globalSubscriptionStatus.description: Email recipients can have one of four subscription statuses: * Confirmed Opt-In - When an email recipient has indicated that they want to receive your campaign and bulk merge email, they are assigned this subscription status. Only a recipient can set his or her subscription status to Confirmed Opt-In. * Soft Opt-In - Recipients with this status can receive opt-in messages that enable them to confirm whether or not they want to receive your email campaigns as well as bulk email. You can set a recipient’s status to Soft Opt-In manually or through a mass update. * Soft Opt-Out - Recipients with this status cannot receive campaign or bulk email messages but can receive opt-in messages. You can change this subscription status to Soft Opt-In manually or through a mass update. * Confirmed Opt-Out - Only the recipient can set their subscription status to Confirmed Opt-Out. Recipients with this status cannot receive email campaigns, bulk email, or opt-in messages. Recipients with this status can only opt in again through the Customer Center or by clicking the link in an email message they have received prior to opting out.

emailTransactions.description: Set a preferred transaction delivery method for this customer. Choose to send transactions by regular mail, by email, by fax, or by a combination of the three. Then, when you select the customer on a transaction, their preferred delivery method is marked by default. * Email – Check this box to check the To Be Emailed box by default on transactions when this customer is selected. * Print – Check this box to check the To Be Printed box by default on transactions when this customer is selected. * Fax – Check this box to check the To Be Faxed box by default on transactions when this customer is selected. Once you enter these settings on the customer record, these boxes are checked by default for transactions created from the customer record or for transactions that are copied or converted. Note: These settings override any customized settings on transaction forms you use. giveAccess.description: Enables access to your NetSuite account for the customer.

globalSubscriptionStatus.description: Email recipients can have one of four subscription statuses: * Confirmed Opt-In - When an email recipient has indicated that they want to receive your campaign and bulk merge email, they are assigned this subscription status. Only a recipient can set his or her subscription status to Confirmed Opt-In. * Soft Opt-In - Recipients with this status can receive opt-in messages that enable them to confirm whether or not they want to receive your email campaigns as well as bulk email. You can set a recipient’s status to Soft Opt-In manually or through a mass update. * Soft Opt-Out - Recipients with this status cannot receive campaign or bulk email messages but can receive opt-in messages. You can change this subscription status to Soft Opt-In manually or through a mass update. * Confirmed Opt-Out - Only the recipient can set their subscription status to Confirmed Opt-Out. Recipients with this status cannot receive email campaigns, bulk email, or opt-in messages. Recipients with this status can only opt in again through the Customer Center or by clicking the link in an email message they have received prior to opting out.

subsidiary.description: Select the subsidiary to associate with this entity or job. You cannot enter transactions for this entity or job unless a subsidiary is assigned. estimatedBudget.description: Enter the estimated budget the prospect or customer has for this opportunity.
estimatedBudget.x-displayName: Estimated Budget{:The estimated budget for a prospective deal}

fax.description: Sets the fax number for the customer.

faxTransactions.description: Set a preferred transaction delivery method for this customer. Choose to send transactions by regular mail, by email, by fax, or by a combination of the three. Then, when you select the customer on a transaction, their preferred delivery method is marked by default. * Email – Check this box to check the To Be Emailed box by default on transactions when this customer is selected. * Print – Check this box to check the To Be Printed box by default on transactions when this customer is selected. * Fax – Check this box to check the To Be Faxed box by default on transactions when this customer is selected. Once you enter these settings on the customer record, these boxes are checked by default for transactions created from the customer record or for transactions that are copied or converted. Note: These settings override any customized settings on transaction forms you use. There are also preferences to set default values for new customer records at Setup > Company > Preferences > Printing, Fax,& Email Preferences. On the Print subtab, Fax subtab, or Email subtab, check Customers Default to [Print/Fax/Email] Transactions. You can also set these fields using the Mass Update function. Go to Lists > Mass Updates > Mass Updates > General and click Customer.

firstName.description: Required when the isPerson field is set as TRUE designation

firstVisit.description: Read-only field that returns the date the customer first.

fxAccount.description: Select the revenue account to use by default to post foreign currency adjustments that result when exchange rates are different for billing and revenue postings for this customer. You must select an income account. You can override this account on a sales order for this customer.

giveAccess.description: Enables access to your NetSuite account for the customer.

globalSubscriptionStatus.description: Email recipients can have one of four subscription statuses: * Confirmed Opt-In - When an email recipient has indicated that they want to receive your campaign and bulk merge email, they are assigned this subscription status. Only a recipient can set his or her subscription status to Confirmed Opt-In. * Soft Opt-In - Recipients with this status can receive opt-in messages that enable them to confirm whether or not they want to receive your email campaigns as well as bulk email. You can set a recipient’s status to Soft Opt-In manually or through a mass update. * Soft Opt-Out - Recipients with this status cannot receive campaign or bulk email messages but can receive opt-in messages. You can change this subscription status to Soft Opt-In manually or through a mass update. * Confirmed Opt-Out - Only the recipient can set their subscription status to Confirmed Opt-Out. Recipients with this status cannot receive email campaigns, bulk email, or opt-in messages. Recipients with this status can only opt in again through the Customer Center or by clicking the link in an email message they have received prior to opting out.

homePhone.description: Only settable when isPerson is set to TRUE defining this.

image.description: References an image file that has already been uploaded.

isBudgetApproved.description: Check this box if the customer's budget has been approved.
isBudgetApproved.x-displayName: Budget Approved{:Whether there is an approved budget for a prospective deal}

isInactive.description: This field is false by default.

isPerson.description: By default, this is set to True which specifies the type.

keywords.description: This is a read-only field that returns the search engine

language.description: References a value in the Language system list.

lastName.description: Required when the isPerson field is set as TRUE designating this customer as an Individual.

lastPageVisited.description: This field displays the last page this customer viewed on his or her most recent visit to your Web site.

lastVisit.description: Read-only field that returns the date the customer first visited the account website.

leadSource.description: If the Marketing Automation feature is not enabled, references a value in a user-defined list created by going to Setup > Sales > CRM Lists. Sets how this customer was referred to the organization. For details on how to modify this list via Web services, see �LeadSource� in the Records Guide. (Note: If the Marketing Automation feature is enabled, the lead source list originates from your list of campaigns.) In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation. For more information, see getSelectValue of the Platform Guide.

middleName.description: Only settable when isPerson is set to TRUE defining this customer as an individual.

mobilePhone.description: Only settable when isPerson is set to TRUE defining this customer as an individual.

negativeNumberFormat.description: Select the customer’s negative number format preference, if any. The format controls whether the negative number is preceded by the minus sign (-) or is enclosed in parentheses ( ).

numberFormat.description: Select the customer’s positive number format preference, if any. The format controls the thousands separator and decimals display.

openingBalance.description: Enter the opening balance of this customer's account.

openingBalanceAccount.description: Select the account this opening balance is applied to.

openingBalanceDate.description: Enter the date of the balance entered in the Opening Balance field.

overdueBalance.description: This field is returned in an advanced search only. It is not returned when using the CustomerSearchBasic search object. Note that in your advanced search you must set the BodyFieldsOnly flag to false. This field is a read-only field. NetSuite converts the overdue balance of all transactions in foreign currencies to your preferred currency using the exchange rate for the current date.

overrideCurrencyFormat.description: Check this box to customize the currency format.
overrideCurrencyFormat.x-displayName: Override Currency Format{:override default currency format}

parent.description: If this customer is subcustomer of another customer or a smaller entity of another customer, select the larger parent customer here. If you select a parent customer in this field, this record will show indented under the parent customer in the Customers list.

partner.description: References a partner record. This value sets the partner responsible for referring this customer. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation. For more information, see getSelectValue of the Platform Guide.

password.description: Sets the password assigned to allow this customer access to NetSuite. As of Version 2014 Release 1, the password must be at least 6 characters long. See the topic NetSuite Password Requirements in the NetSuite Help Center for more information.

phoneticName.description: Enter the furigana character you want to use to sort this record.

prefCCProcessor.description: References a record at Setup > Company > Credit Card Processors. Sets the credit card processor used to process orders. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation. For more information, see getSelectValue of the Platform Guide.

priceLevel.description: References a value in a user-defined list at Setup > Accounting > Setup Tasks > Accounting Lists > Price Level. This value sets the price level for selling to this customer. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation. For more information, see getSelectValue of the Platform Guide.

printOnCheckAs.description: What you enter here prints on the Pay to the Order of line of a check instead of what you entered in the Customer field.

printTransactions.description: Set a preferred transaction delivery method for this customer. Choose to send transactions by regular mail, by email, by fax, or by a combination of the three. Then, when you select the customer on a transaction, their preferred delivery method is marked by default. * Email – Check this box to check the To Be Emailed box by default on transactions when this customer is selected. * Print – Check this box to check the To Be Printed box by default on transactions when this customer is selected. * Fax – Check this box to check the To Be Faxed box by default on transactions when this customer is selected. Once you enter these settings on the customer record, these boxes are checked by default for transactions created from the customer record or for transactions that are copied or converted. Note: These settings override any customized settings on transaction forms you use. There are also preferences to set default values for new customer records at Setup > Company > Preferences > Printing, Fax,& Email Preferences. On the Print subtab, Fax subtab, or Email subtab, check Customers Default to [Print/Fax/Email] Transactions. You can also set these fields using the Mass Update function. Go to Lists > Mass Updates > Mass Updates > General and click Customer.

receivablesAccount.description: Choose the A/R account to use by default on receivables transactions for this customer. If you select Use System Preference, the account selected at <_TABNAME=ADMI_ACCTSETUP_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=ADMI_ACCTSETUP_> > Accounting Preferences > Items/Transactions in the Default Receivables Account field is used as this customer's default.

referrer.description: Read-only field that returns the site that referred the customer to the NetSuite account website.

reminderDays.description: Sets the number of days before the end date that a reminder should be sent for renewing a customer's contract or project.

representingSubsidiary.description: Indicates that this entity is an intercompany customer. Select the subsidiary this customer represents as a buyer in intercompany transactions.

requirePwdChange.description: This field is only settable on Add. If set to TRUE, the customer is required to change the default password assign on the first login attempt.
requirePwdChange.x-displayName: Require Password Change On Next Login

resaleNumber.description: Customer's tax license number for cases where you do not collect sales tax from this customer because the merchandise will be resold.

salesGroup.description: When team selling is enabled, this references a user defined sales team group at Lists > Relationships > Groups. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation. For more information, see getSelectValue of the Platform Guide.

salesReadiness.description: Choose how close the prospect or customer is to purchasing. You can create additional options for this field at <_TABNAME=LIST_CRMOTHERLIST_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=LIST_CRMOTHERLIST_> > CRM Lists.
salesReadiness.x-displayName: Sales Readiness{:How ready a customer is to buy a prospective deal}

salesRep.description: References an employee record. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation. For more information, see getSelectValue of the Platform Guide.

salutation.description: Enter the title of this person, such as Mr., Mrs., Ms., Dr., Rev., etc.

sendEmail.description: If true, the customer is automatically notified via e-mail when new access to NetSuite is provided.

shipComplete.description: Check this box if you only want to ship orders to this customer when they are completely fulfilled.

shippingItem.description: References a value in a user-defined list at Lists > Accounting > Shipping Items. This value sets the default shipping method for this customer. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation. For more information, see getSelectValue of the Platform Guide.

stage.description: This is a read only field that references a value in a system list. Possible values include LEAD, PROSPECT or CUSTOMER. This value refers to the stage of customer that is being created and are the values that should be submitted as the internal ID values when performing a search. NetSuite automatically updates the customer stage when certain customer status (entityStatus field) changes occur. For more information, see the section Understanding Customer Stages in the SuiteTalk (Web Services) Records Guide.

startDate.description: Enter the date this person or company became a customer, lead or prospect. If this person or company has a contract with you, enter the start date of the contract. If you enter an estimate or an opportunity for this customer, this field will be updated with the date of that transaction.

subsidiary.description: Select the subsidiary to associate with this entity or job. You cannot enter transactions for this entity or job unless a subsidiary is assigned. If you select this entity on a transaction, the transaction is associated with this subsidiary. The entity is able to access only information associated with this subsidiary. Note: Once a transaction has posted for the entity or job, you are not able to change the subsidiary selected on the entity or job record.

symbolPlacement.description: Select whether the symbol appears before or after the number.
symbolPlacement.x-displayName: Symbol Placement{:where to put the currency symbol, i.e. before or after number}

syncPartnerTeams.description: Check this box if you want to update this customer's transactions to reflect the changes you make to the partner team.

taxItem.description: References a value in a user-defined list at Setup > Accounting > Taxes > Tax Codes. This value provides the standard tax rate associated with this customer. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation. For more information, see getSelectValue of the Platform Guide.

taxable.description: True indicates that this customer pays sales tax according to the rate defined in the tax Item field. False indicates that this customer does not pay sales tax, but only if Tax Item field is empty.

terms.description: References a value in a user-defined list at Setup > Accounting > Setup Tasks > Accounting Lists > Term. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation. For more information, see getSelectValue of the Platform Guide.

territory.description: References a value in a user-defined list at Setup > Sales > Sales Management > Sales Territories. This value sets the sales territory this customer belongs in. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation. For more information, see getSelectValue of the Platform Guide.

thirdPartyAcct.description: Enter this customer’s FedEx® or UPS® account number in the 3rd Party Billing Account Number field. This account number is used if you select Consignee Billing on item fulfillments using UPS or select Bill Recipient on item fulfillments using FedEx.

thirdPartyCountry.description: Select the country associated with the customer’s UPS or FedEx account number.

thirdPartyZipcode.description: Enter the zip code associated with the customer’s UPS or FedEx account number.

title.description: Enter the job title for this person's position at his or her company.

unbilledOrders.description: This field displays the total amount of orders that have been entered but not yet billed. If you have enabled the preference Customer Credit Limit Includes Orders, then this total is included in credit limit calculations. Set this preference at <_TABNAME=ADMI_ACCTSETUP_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=ADMI_ACCTSETUP_> > Set Up Accounting > General. If you use the Multiple Currencies feature, the amount in this field is shown in the customer's currency.

url.description: Sets the URL associated with the customer.

vatRegNumber.description: For the UK edition only. Note that this field is not validated when submitted via Web services.

visits.description: This field displays the total number of visits this customer has made to your Web site. A new visit is counted after the customer leaves your site and returns.

webLead.description: This is a read-only hidden field that defines whether a customer registered via a NetSuite website. It returns a string of either Yes or No.

description.x-samplevalue: Server error - Something went wrong on the Cloud Elements server
Provider server error - Something went wrong on the Provider or Endpoint's server

internalId.x-conditionally-required-description: This field is required when 'name' is not present in the request

name.x-conditionally-required-description: This field is required when 'internalId' is not present in the request

job_query.x-samplevalue: SELECT attributes.organizationid, attributes.systemuserid, organizationid FROM users WHERE organizationid = '3b80f68d-b945-4208-9442-f55bd0e1c5b2'

accessLevel.description: The default value is false. True indicates that the task is private.

assigned.description: References an entity record that already exists in your account. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.

company.description: References a company record that already exists in your account. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.

completedDate.description: Enter the date this task was actually completed.

contact.description: References a contact record that already exists in your account. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.

customForm.description: References an existing custom form for this record type. To ensure that field relationships defined within a desired custom form are maintained, you must provide the customForm value. Also, if defaults are off, then customForm is required, if defaults are on then the default form is used. Internal ID values for existing forms can be found at Setup > Customization > Entry Forms. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.

dueDate.description: Enter the projected date when this task needs to be complete.

endDate.description: This field is required in the UI but not when submitting requests via Web services.

estimatedTime.description: In the Initial Time Budget field, enter your first approximation of the amount of time this task will take. Later, you can increase or decrease your time estimate in the Current Time Budget field. By maintaining an initial time estimate in this field, you can compare your initial estimate to your altered estimate. If you entered a time estimate on a job task template, that amount shows here.

estimatedTimeOverride.description: If your estimate of the time this task will take increases or decreases from your original estimate, enter the altered estimate in the Current Time Budget field.

message.description: Enter any comments about this task. These comments appear in the e-mail sent to the person this task is assigned to.

milestone.description: In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.

owner.description: References an entity record that already exists in your account. The field defaults to the current user. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.

parent.description: Select the parent task if this task is the subordinate of another. Note: By identifying this task as a subordinate, the parent task becomes a summary task. A summary task cannot have resources assigned to it because it does not track work, it only tracks information about subordinate tasks.

percentComplete.description: In the Percent Complete field, enter an estimate of how much of the total amount of work for this task is already completed. For example, if half the work toward completion is done, enter 50%. Note: The percentage you enter in this field overrides the auto-calculated figure in the Percent Time Complete field and is used for task calculations.

priority.description: The values used to populate this field are _low, _medium or _high.

reminderMinutes.description: This field is settable only if timedEvent is set to TRUE.

reminderType.description: This field is settable only if timedEvent is set to TRUE.

startDate.description: This field has a default value of the current date and time. It is required in the UI but not when submitting requests via Web services.

status.description: The values used to populate this field are _notStarted, _inProgress or _completed.

supportCase.description: In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.

timedEvent.description: In Web services the startTime and endTime field are not exposed. Therefore, to set start and end times for a timed task, users must first set the timedEvent field to TRUE. Then the time component of the DateTime value that is specified in startDate will be set for startTime, and the time component of the DateTime value that is specified in endDate will be set for endTime. Note that the fields reminderMinutes and reminderType are also only settable if timedEvent is set to TRUE.

title.description: Enter a name for this task. This name is the subject line of the e-mail sent to the assignee if you check the Send e-mail box. This title also appears to others if the Private Task box is not checked. The title shows on the Tasks list.

transaction.description: References an opportunity record that already exists in your account. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.

instanceId.description: Instance Id of the bulk job

description.x-samplevalue: The authorization tokens. The format for the header value is 'Element <token>, User <user secret>'

accessRole.description: References a value in a user-defined list at Setup > Users/Roles > Manage Roles. This value sets the role assigned to this customer. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation. For more information, see getSelectValue of the Platform Guide.

accountNumber.description: Assigned account number for this customer. Required when ...

alcoholRecipientType.description: FedEx requires that all packages containing alcohol are declared with the intended recipient type on the shipping note. This preference sets the default type for this customer.

altEmail.description: Enter an alternative email address for this person.

altName.description: This is the name of this person or company.

altPhone.description: Phone numbers can be entered in the following formats: 99...

billPay.description: When enabled, the companyName, phone, accountNumber field...

buyingReason.description: Choose the prospect or customer's reason for buying from your company. You can create additional options for this field at <_TABNAME=LIST_CRMOTHERLIST_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=LIST_CRMOTHERLIST_> > CRM Lists.

buyingTimeFrame.description: Select the time frame for the prospect or customer to purchase. You can create additional options for this field at <_TABNAME=LIST_CRMOTHERLIST_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=LIST_CRMOTHERLIST_> > CRM Lists.

campaignCategory.description: References a value in a user defined list at Setup > Marketing > Campaign Categories. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation. For more information, see getSelectValue of the Platform Guide.

category.description: References a value in a user defined list at Setup > Acco...

comments.description: Enter any other information you wish to track for this customer.

companyName.description: The name of the customer. Required when billPay is enable...
companyName.x-conditionally-required-description: The name of the customer. Required when billPay is enable...

creditLimit.description: A credit limit for this customer. If set, and depending on preferences, a warning is generated when this customer's limit is exceeded during a transaction addition.

currency.description: References a value in a user-defined list at Lists > Acco...

customForm.description: References an existing custom form for this record type. ...

defaultOrderPriority.description: Enter a number to designate the priority for this customer.

drAccount.description: Select the deferred revenue account to use by default to post revenue reclassification amounts generated by revenue reclassification journal entries for this customer. You can override this account on a sales order for this customer.

emailPreference.description: Reference to a value in a system list. Values: _PDF, _HTM...

emailTransactions.description: Set a preferred transaction delivery method for this customer. Choose to send transactions by regular mail, by email, by fax, or by a combination of the three. Then, when you select the customer on a transaction, their preferred delivery method is marked by default. * Email – Check this box to check the To Be Emailed box by default on transactions when this customer is selected. * Print – Check this box to check the To Be Printed box by default on transactions when this customer is selected. * Fax – Check this box to check the To Be Faxed box by default on transactions when this customer is selected. Once you enter these settings on the customer record, these boxes are checked by default for transactions created from the customer record or for transactions that are copied or converted. Note: These settings override any customized settings on transaction forms you use. There are also preferences to set default values for new customer records at Setup > Company > Preferences > Printing, Fax,& Email Preferences. On the Print subtab, Fax subtab, or Email subtab, check Customers Default to [Print/Fax/Email] Transactions. You can also set these fields using the Mass Update function. globalSubscriptionStatus.description: Email recipients can have one of four subscription statuses: * Confirmed Opt-In - When an email recipient has indicated that they want to receive your campaign and bulk merge email, they are assigned this subscription status. Only a recipient can set his or her subscription status to Confirmed Opt-In. * Soft Opt-In - Recipients with this status can receive opt-in messages that enable them to confirm whether or not they want to receive your email campaigns as well as bulk email. You can set a recipient’s status to Soft Opt-In manually or through a mass update. * Soft Opt-Out - Recipients with this status cannot receive campaign or bulk email messages but can receive opt-in messages. You can change this subscription status to Soft Opt-In manually or through a mass update. * Confirmed Opt-Out - Only the recipient can set their subscription status to Confirmed Opt-Out. Recipients with this status cannot receive email campaigns, bulk email, or opt-in messages. Recipients with this status can only opt in again through the Customer Center or by clicking the link in an email message they have received prior to opting out.

If you have already selected items on this transaction, selecting a new currency refreshes them to show the price in the new currency (except for items you entered custom prices for) and recalculates tax and gross profit.

estGrossProfit.description: Estimated Gross Profit: Read-only field that equals the revenue amount minus the Est. Cost. At the transaction level, it equals the gross profit of all lines, factoring transaction-level discounts and markups.

estGrossProfitPercent.description: Estimated Gross Profit Margin, as a percentage: Read-only field that equals the Est. Gross Profit divided by revenue, expressed as a percentage. At the transaction level, it equals the gross profit percent of all lines, factoring transaction-level discounts and markups.

probability.description: If the value for probability is not provided, a calculated value based on the Status populates the field. If the value for probability is set, it overrides the slaved value depending on the default settings. rangeHigh.description: If not provided, this field is calculated. Provided values may be overridden by the system. See Projected Total, Range High and Range Low Fields.

rangeLow.description: If not provided, this field is calculated. Provided values may be overridden by the system. See Projected Total, Range High and Range Low Fields.
